Title.evidence: The Stockholm III trial randomly assigned 840 patients

Participants.evidence: Patients with biopsy-proven resectable adenocarcinoma of the rectum were included.

Intervention.evidence: short-course radiotherapy of 5 × 5 Gy with surgery within 1 week (SRT), short-course radiotherapy of 5 × 5 Gy with surgery after 4–8 weeks (SRT-delay), or long-course radiotherapy of 25 × 2 Gy with surgery after 4–8 weeks (LRT-delay).

Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary outcome was time to local recurrence (LR)

Number_Randomised.evidence: 357, 355, and 128 patients were randomized to the SRT, SRT-delay, and LRT-delay groups respectively.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Patients were analysed in a three-arm randomization and a short-course radiotherapy comparison.

Result_Outcome.evidence: the incidence of LR was three of 129 patients, four of 128, and seven of 128
